items.sentence: Since I lived in Tokyo, I know that city pretty well.
Whenever he comes up to Tokyo, he stays at our house.
Tom wore an orange hat, and his coat was orange, too.
I think that Tom may come to Boston for Thanksgiving.
Back then, I didn't earn enough to support my family.
I can't buy anything today. I left my wallet at home.
I can't decide whether I should go to college or not.
I can't disclose any information about the informant.
We always walk by the post office on the way to work.
Tom said he hoped that Mary would be able to do that.
